image.altText: A mother kissing her young son.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide mother who has two months to find somewhere to live with her severely disabled son says she was told to "manifest a home" and use witchcraft or consider living in a tent.

title.children: Public servant advises woman facing homelessness to 'use witchcraft' or 'manifest' home

image.altText: The Robe Obelisk sitting on a large rock with the Southern Ocean and blue sky in the background

props.synopsis: Saving South Australia's iconic Robe Obelisk from worsening coastal erosion could cost $1.5 million, but locals say it's worth the money and effort.

title.children: Million dollar price tag to save iconic 169yo obelisk before it falls into the sea

image.altText: An old woman in pink shirt and cream cardigan sits in between two high school students in school uniform

props.synopsis: An Adelaide program bringing together the old and young has helped participants form unlikely connections. Psychologists say it's helping them socialise, connect and understand each other, and could have mood-boosting effects and lasting health benefits.

title.children: Unlikely friendships between teenagers and older Australians key to happiness in aged care

image.altText: Composite of a man and woman smiling.

props.synopsis: Kira Korolev and her husband Igor mostly kept to themselves", say neighbours, who are surprised their unit complex is now the centre of a national espionage investigation.

title.children: Russian-Australian woman charged with spying offences was well-travelled, made lifestyle videos

image.altText: A man with a blurred face is led up a path by two other men with blurred faces.

props.synopsis: Two Russian-born Australian citizens have been accused of obtaining Australian Defence Force material to share with Russian authorities. Look back through our blog to see how the day's events unfolded.

title.children: ADF member and husband accused of attempting to access classified documents for Russia — as it happened

image.altText: A woman with glasses looking serious in front of a yellow wall

props.synopsis: Government data has revealed nearly 50 people have been charged with sexual offences against children in state care in the past two years, prompting SA's child protection watchdog to call on the government to respond more quickly when it suspects a child is at risk of sexual abuse.

title.children: Data reveals nearly 50 people have been charged with sexual offences against children in state care

image.altText: A woman with grey hair wearing a check jacket and pearls

props.synopsis: Commissioner Ann Vanstone, who announced her resignation two days ago, says the state's integrity agency is the weakest in the country, which only benefits "those who are corrupt".

title.children: 'Weakest' ICAC in the nation benefits the corrupt, outgoing SA commissioner says

image.altText: Biden speaks from behind a lectern with american flags behind him

props.synopsis: Joe Biden boasts and blames his way through a high-stakes appearance as questions over whether he should drop out of the upcoming election linger, writes North America correspondent Barbara Miller.

title.children: Vice-President Trump and President Putin of Ukraine — Joe Biden's gaffes keep coming, but he says he's not budging

image.altText: A man in handcuffs is escorted through a doorway by two policemen, with one holding him by the arm

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man has been found guilty over his involvement in an Adelaide city nightclub stabbing in which multiple people were stabbed. Mathiang Malok, 25, committed aggravated affray and two counts of aggravated causing harm with intent to cause harm, a judge has found.

title.children: Melbourne man found guilty of 'clearly deliberate' and 'focused' SA nightclub stabbing

image.altText: Joe Biden has a stern expression and points at something.

props.synopsis: The US president addressed the media conference with mounting calls for him to step down ahead of November's election, as opinion polls show Donald Trump increasing his lead in the wake of Mr Biden disastrous performance in last month's presidential debate.

title.children: Seven stand-out moments from Joe Biden's high-pressure press conference

image.altText: The couple stand holding a koala

props.synopsis: The family of two Australian victims of a suspected murder at a luxury resort in the Philippines have released a statement saying the situation is "like living a nightmare" and they are "praying for answers".

title.children: Philippines police open special investigation into suspected murder of Australian couple as hunt for suspect continues

image.altText: A female gymnast puts chalk on her feet.

props.synopsis: An Australian gymnastics coach selected for the Paris Olympics is accused of making comments about a former colleague's breasts and calling her a "minion".

title.children: 'You cannot use that word': Olympic gymnastics coach allegedly made comments about student's body

image.altText: A graphic representation of an anime film.

props.synopsis: A look into the transformative journey of Japanese anime from World War II propaganda reels to today's billion-dollar, Pokemon-filled world.

title.children: Would you spend half a billion dollars just to be 'cool'? Here's why Japan thought it was a critical investment

image.altText: Burgess and Kershaw stand at a lectern speaking.

props.synopsis: Two Russian-born Australian citizens are accused of obtaining Australian Defence Force material to share with Russian authorities.

title.children: 'We know who you are': AFP chief warns Australians spying for foreign governments

image.altText: Woman wearing an Akubra hat in selfie

props.synopsis: Call for the mandatory return of income support management has some on the edge of tears and fears people could leave towns to avoid the reintroduction.

title.children: 'Don't think we'd survive it': Anxieties that Morrison-era policy could return amid cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: Richard Marles and Joe Biden shake hands.

props.synopsis: The Australian government is set to give Ukraine another $250 million in military support — its largest contribution to the war effort to date.

title.children: Australia pledges biggest ever boost for Ukraine as NATO calls out China as Russia's 'enabler'

image.altText: Shelley Duvall with short blonde hair and a fringe smiles at the camera wearing a red shirt

props.synopsis: Shelley Duvall — a regular star in some of the defining movies of the 1970s and 1980s — dies decades after retreating from the spotlight and settling in a small town in Texas.

title.children: Shelley Duvall — star of The Shining and a regular in Robert Altman films — dies aged 75

image.altText: Aerial shot of massive oil and gas rig in the Bass Strait off Victoria

props.synopsis: Offshore gas supplies are running out in the Bass Strait and there are plans to dismantle some of Esso's ocean gas rigs. But the company's intention to leave parts of them in the sea has sparked concerns.

title.children: 'No excuse': Controversy over Esso's plans to dismantle offshore gas rigs

image.altText: Signs held by three people who's faces are not shown. One signs says 'end racism'.

props.synopsis: Findings in a Human Rights Commission report show governments across all sectors are failing to identify and deal with racism across the country. The country's Race Discrimination Commissioner says there are "systemic failures" in dealing with racism that need to change.

title.children: 'Not good enough': Governments fail on racism against First Nations and culturally diverse people, report finds

image.altText: A businessman in a red tie raises his hand

props.synopsis: CEO bonuses are becoming a "given" according to a long-running study, despite a rise in investor strikes against remuneration reports.

title.children: The ASX's top earning CEO took home nearly $50m in pay last year, but many execs took a (modest) pay cut

image.altText: Max Purcell and Jordan Thompson during a doubles match at Wimbledon

props.synopsis: Some under-the-radar Aussies are bound for the final while one of the great women's semifinals sets pulses racing on centre court. Here are the five quick hits from day 11 at Wimbledon.

title.children: Five quick hits: Aussies advance to Wimbledon final as marathon women's semi takes players to breaking point

image.altText: ASX 200 board

props.synopsis: Australian shares have set a new record high during trade on Friday after official figures showed inflation has fallen in the US, leading to increased speculation that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates in September. Follow live.

title.children: Australian shares hit new record high after falling US inflation fuels interest rate cut speculation

image.altText: Michelle Law and her partner Dave stand cheek to cheek, smiling for a selfie.

props.synopsis: Before my partner and I moved in together, we made a spreadsheet to divide the "mental load" surrounding housework. It worked for more than a year, until significant life changes led us to take a different approach.

title.children: A spreadsheet helped us split the mental load until our lives changed

image.altText: darren zanow with voters at a pre-polling booth

props.synopsis: The state MP for Ipswich West has announced he has been diagnosed with microvascular ischemic disease and will step down at the October election.

title.children: 'My time in public office — and likely my life — will be cut short': New MP forced to resign after shock diagnosis

image.altText: Jen Daine stands under two bridges and looks up into the distrance.

props.synopsis: Commercial photographer Jen Dainer was applying for the Army Reserve when a question about the date of her last period stopped her in her tracks. A Department of Defence spokesperson said the content of the questionnaire is being revised.

title.children: 'I was just shocked to see that question in 2024': Army Reserve applicant withdraws over period question

image.altText: A court sketch of Brendan Luke Stevens, who has a beard and wears a green shirt.

props.synopsis: The self-proclaimed leader of a religious group accused of causing the death of an eight-year-old girl has told a court that the case against them is "religious persecution" and that the group doesn't care what judgement is delivered.

title.children: Religious group 'well within our rights' to believe God would save Elizabeth Struhs, leader tells court

image.altText: A drawing of a mammoth surrounded by tusks and bones

props.synopsis: An incredibly well-preserved woolly mammoth specimen that died 52,000 years ago in Siberia has now had its chromosome structure reassembled for the first time.

title.children: Mammoth found in 'deep freezer' provides the first ever 3D chromosomal structure for ancient DNA

props.synopsis: South Korea promotes closer defence ties as it seeks to win a lucrative contract to deliver the Royal Australian Navy’s new fleet of frigates.

title.children: South Korea pushes Australia on AUKUS, cyber cooperation as it eyes $10b warship prize

image.altText: A woman holds a mobile phone while waiting to cross the road in Brisbane's CBD.

props.synopsis: If you've got a phone, it's likely you've been on the receiving end of more than a few scam text messages or calls.

title.children: Scammers are using our scam awareness against us

image.altText: Old photo of ship

props.synopsis: The surviving families of the sailors aboard the SS Nemesis have held a memorial at the site of the wreck, uncovered by accident earlier this year, to mark 120 years since its sinking.

title.children: Descendents of SS Nemesis' shipwrecked sailors put 120-year-old 'mystery' to rest

image.altText: couple, woman with plastic crown

props.synopsis: There are calls for legislative change as the inquest into the 2019 Corrective Services shooting death of Wiradjuri man Dwayne Johnstone ends with the coroner to hand down her findings and recommendations in late August.

title.children: Partner's 'devastating emptiness' as hearing into Corrective Services shooting of Dwayne Johnstone ends

image.altText: A factory is engulfed in range flames and black smoke.

props.synopsis: Authorities have revealed a number of firefighters were treated in hospital for headaches and high heart rates after battling the Derrimut chemical fire.

title.children: Firefighters' health monitored as investigators probe cause of Melbourne chemical explosion

image.altText: Alec Baldwin with prayer hands to his face sitting next to a member of his legal team, wearing a suit, blue shirt

props.synopsis: On day two of Alec Baldwin's involuntary manslaughter trial into the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins, the court heard from numerous witnesses including gun manufacturer Alessandro Pietta, who produced the weapon used on the set of Rust.

title.children: Gun manufacturer tells Alec Baldwin trial trigger needs to be pulled for weapon to go off
